TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UnmanagedMemoryStream extends System.IO.Stream

summary.span: Provides access to unmanaged blocks of memory from managed code.

span.span: Provides access to unmanaged blocks of memory from managed code.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此类支持对非托管内存使用现有的基于流的模型的访问，不需要非托管内存中的内容被复制到堆。This class supports access to unmanaged memory using the existing stream-based model and does not require that the contents in the unmanaged memory be copied to the heap. [!INCLUDE[note_unnecessary_dispose](~/includes/note-unnecessary-dispose.md)] ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何读取和写入到非托管的内存使用类。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 非托管内存块进行分配和解除分配使用类。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. [!code-csharp[System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream/cs/sample.cs#1)]

summary.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified location, memory length, total amount of memory, and file access values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `length`参数定义中使用的当前内存量。The `length` parameter defines the current amount of memory in use. 如果读取或将数据追加到流，`length`值应该等于要从中读取的流中有效的数据量或保留的。If reading or appending data to the stream, the `length` value should be equal to the amount of valid data in the stream to be read from or preserved. 如果写入到流，此值应为零。If writing to the stream, this value should be zero. `capacity`参数指示的可用总内存量。The `capacity` parameter indicates the amount of total memory available. 此值可以描述的长度超过指定的长度的区域，或指示可以追加到的区域。This value can describe a region that is longer than the length specified, or indicate a region that can be appended to. 任何尝试编写超出此值将失败。Any attempt to write beyond this value will fail. `access`参数集，和属性。The `access` parameter sets the , and properties. 请注意该指定不保证该流将是可写。Note that specifying does not guarantee that the stream will be writable. 访问参数允许实施者创建其实现可以与公开实际流匹配的对象。The access parameters allow the implementer to create an object whose implementation can match the actual stream that is exposed. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何读取和写入到非托管的内存使用类。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 非托管内存块进行分配和解除分配使用类。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. [!code-csharp[System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream/cs/sample.cs#1)]

param.name: disposing
param.span: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

summary.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

span.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用此方法由公共方法和方法。This method is called by the public method and the method. 调用受保护方法替换`disposing`参数设置为`true`。 invokes the protected method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. 调用与`disposing`设置为`false`。 invokes with `disposing` set to `false`. 当 `disposing` 参数为 `true` 时，此方法释放该 引用的、由任何托管对象持有的全部资源。When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. 此方法调用每个引用对象的 方法。This method invokes the method of each referenced object.

span.para: 可以多次调用由其他对象。重写时小心不要引用已经释放的早期调用中的对象。详细了解如何实现，请参阅 [实现 Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。有关详细信息和，请参阅 [清理了非托管 Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。

can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to . For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法等效于构造函数。This method is equivalent to the constructor. 它支持需要初始化之前设置流变量的指针，并且，因此，不能调用参数化构造函数的方法。It supports methods that need to initialize the pointer before setting stream variables and, therefore, cannot call the parameterized constructor. 此类方法应使用默认构造函数中，初始化指针，然后调用方法。Such methods should use the default constructor, , initialize the pointer, and then invoke the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 初始化一个流时，此属性设置为零。When a stream is initialized, this property is set to zero. 尽管您可以设置流的容量超出流的当前位置，您将无法再访问该区域中使用和方法。Although you can set the position of the stream beyond the stream's capacity, you will not be able to access that area using the and methods. 将返回 0 并将引发。 will return 0 and will throw a . 这种支持主要是为了与基本流操作的设计和代码兼容性。This support is primarily for design and code compatibility with basic stream operations.

summary.span: Reads the specified number of bytes into the specified array.

span.span: Reads the specified number of bytes into the specified array.

returns.span: The total number of bytes read into the buffer.

span.span: The total number of bytes read into the buffer.

returns.span: This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

span.span: This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `offset`参数指定了中的字节偏移量`array`在此处开始读取，参数 （缓冲区索引） 和`count`参数给出的最大要从此流读取的字节数。The `offset` parameter gives the offset of the byte in the `array` parameter (the buffer index) at which to begin reading, and the `count` parameter gives the maximum number of bytes to be read from this stream. 如果已到达流的结尾，返回的值是字节读取，则为零的实际数目。The returned value is the actual number of bytes read, or zero if the end of the stream is reached. 如果读取的操作成功，流的当前位置前进读取的字节数。If the read operation is successful, the current position of the stream is advanced by the number of bytes read. 如果发生异常，则流的当前位置不变。If an exception occurs, the current position of the stream is unchanged. 方法将返回仅在到达流的末尾后的零。The method returns zero only after reaching the end of the stream. 否则为始终至少一个字节从流中读取返回之前。Otherwise, always reads at least one byte from the stream before returning. 没有数据时调用流中是否可用，直到可以返回至少一个字节的数据，将阻止该方法。If no data is available from the stream upon a call to , the method will block until at least one byte of data can be returned. 实现可以自由地返回少于所请求的字节，即使尚未达到流结尾。An implementation is free to return fewer bytes than requested even if the end of the stream has not been reached. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何读取和写入到非托管的内存使用类。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 非托管内存块进行分配和解除分配使用类。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. [!code-csharp[System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream/cs/sample.cs#1)]

span.span: The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached.

summary.span: Reads a byte from a stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.

span.span: Reads a byte from a stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.

returns.span: The unsigned byte cast to an object, or -1 if at the end of the stream.

span.span: The unsigned byte cast to an object, or -1 if at the end of the stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法从流中返回整数值。Use this method to return integer values from the stream. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何读取和写入到非托管的内存使用类。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 非托管内存块进行分配和解除分配使用类。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. 在此示例中，对象传递给其检查的方法然后再尝试读取并向控制台显示的内容的属性。In this example, an object is passed to a method which checks the property before attempting to read and display the contents to the console. [!code-csharp[System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream_Example#00](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream_Example/cs/program.cs#00)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果给定的值小于当前流的长度，则流被截断。If the given value is less than the current length of the stream, the stream is truncated. 如果给定的值大于流的当前长度，则流被扩展。If the given value is larger than the current length of the stream, the stream is expanded. 如果流已展开，旧的和新的长度之间的流的内容未定义。If the stream is expanded, the contents of the stream between the old and the new lengths are undefined. 流必须支持写入和查找有关工作。A stream must support both writing and seeking for to work.
